item.title: Interning at Camp Social
item.description: ![[images/Pasted image 20221117232128.png]] Communities form to coordinate efforts, share resources, and achieve positive-sum outcomes. While aligning the value received by community leaders and participants has always been important, modern communities can go further to establish a tighter connection between the value to members and the overall organization’s worth.

item.title: Designing Collective Community Interfaces
item.description: At my school, clubs develop teams to streamline workflows and produce content as quickly as possible. One of the most common positions was web and tech, providing students the opportunity to take technical challenges in designing websites and configuring AV equipment.

item.title: Imagineering With Hack Club
item.description: This summer, I got the opportunity to work with Hack Club to redesign their application flow. This would handle all new applications for students to start a Hack Club at their own schools, connecting students with delegates from around the world.

item.title: List of Projects I'm Proud Of
Pseudoscience
item.description: Pseudosciences are disciplines, fields or beliefs that claim to offer systematic knowledge about the natural world, but which are not based on the scientific method.

item.title: Relativism
item.description: How was Edison’s approach to science and innovation different to Tesla’s? Approaches to science, for Eddison and Tesla, became congruent with approaches to social systems.

This week, in our TOK class, we watched a documentary called The Rachel Divide, featuring a woman who identified as Black although she was born to two white parents.
